generated_json.title: Chief Complaint
content: Recurrent cyst on wrist with recurrence after prior surgical removal, now seeking aspiration due to increasing discomfort

generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports a recurrent cyst on the wrist that has reappeared after a prior surgical excision approximately 8 years ago. The cyst is noted to recur with repetitive wrist movements, particularly during push-ups and bench presses, suggesting mechanical exacerbation. The current lesion has become increasingly bothersome, prompting the patient to seek intervention. The patient expresses concern about the discomfort but notes it is not severe enough to warrant immediate surgery. The patient previously underwent a surgical procedure for a similar cyst and recalls the recurrence rate as approximately 10%. The patient is considering aspiration as a less invasive option, acknowledging that it may refill. The patient also reports residual symptoms from a prior nerve surgery involving the medial tibial nerve, including tingling and paresthesia, which are described as part of the nerve regeneration process. The patient notes that the sensation is not painful but is still present, particularly with certain movements or impacts. The patient is uncertain whether the symptoms are due to nerve waking up or ongoing mechanical irritation. The patient is currently undergoing physical therapy and strengthening exercises and is concerned about desensitization. The patient is open to further evaluation and treatment, including potential referral to hand therapy for nerve desensitization protocols.
generated_json.instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity or intensity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since their onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy. Describe how these symptoms impact the patient's daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any pertinent interactions or conversations related to the illness.

generated_json.title: Past Medical History
content: Prior surgical excision of a wrist cyst 8 years ago; history of medial tibial nerve surgery involving soft tissue neurolysis, interposition grafting, and RPNI (reversed posterior nerve interposition) for nerve injury; history of leg surgery with postoperative nerve regeneration and ongoing sensory symptoms.

Any previous hospital admissions, not related to the present illness, including the reason for admission, dates, and outcomes. generated_json.title: Current Medications
generated_json.instruction: Document the patient's current medications in the following format: Begin with the full generic name of each medication, followed by the brand name in parentheses if applicable (e.g., "Aspirin (Bayer)"). Describe the route of administration, such as oral, topical, or by injection (e.g., "Oral Aspirin"). Lastly, for ongoing medications, note the duration for which the patient has been taking each medication (e.g., "on Aspirin for 3 weeks"). If no current medications are reported, document "No current medications found."

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Schedule aspiration of recurrent wrist cyst under local anesthesia with IV sedation at outpatient surgery center in Lindon.
Perform complete excision of cyst with identification and removal of the stalk at the wrist joint.
Consider removal of associated skin tag if patient desires, though it may not be covered by insurance.
Prescribe post-procedure splinting for one week to limit wrist motion and protect the surgical site.
Schedule follow-up for suture removal at 2 weeks post-procedure.
Refer patient to hand therapy for nerve desensitization protocols due to persistent paresthesia following prior nerve surgery.
Recommend nerve glide exercises and home-based desensitization techniques as part of rehabilitation.
Monitor for recurrence of cyst and consider repeat excision if symptomatic recurrence occurs.
Continue observation of medial tibial nerve symptoms, as they are likely part of ongoing regeneration process.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.

content: Next Appointment: Schedule the next appointment for the aspiration procedure in the next 1–2 weeks.
